title: First, it looks like creating headless fragment from activity is more proper…
message:
First, it looks like creating headless fragment from activity is more proper than creating from UI fragment.
In the latter case robolectric tests of this UI fragment will fail (see FragmentTestUtil).
Tests will fail with recursive transaction exception.

Second, despite of all manuals, references and SO discussions we need view id for headless fragment.
Otherwise application throws "IllegalStateException: Fragment xxx did not create a view" on Activity.setContentView.

These are necessary preconditions for this exception:
- fragment transaction in Activity.onCreate;
- fragment element in activity layout.

title: Trying to change orientation but getting error:
message:
Trying to change orientation but getting error:

IllegalArgumentException: No view found for id 0x7f07003c (com.github.dddpaul.netcat:id/pager) for fragment ResultFragment

The reason is that retained ResultFragment stores reference to ViewPager in mContainer field.

title: It seems that there is only one way to pass mock with defined behaviour to system-under-test
message:
It seems that there is only one way to pass mock with defined behaviour to system-under-test
(SUT, fragment in our case) - through simple setter in this fragment.

When I try to inject mock through Dagger's MockModule (which overrides regular Module) the
behaviour of this injected mock is lost.
